duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage territory for recruiting freshman, transfer, international, and/or graduate enrollees and/or prospective students.
Plan and implement all recruitment functions to increase student enrollment.
Organize, create, and participate in events, both on and off campus, as well as virtual events.
Provide advice and counsel to prospective students and parents about specific educational opportunities, admissions requirements, and financial aid and scholarship processes.
Serve as a mentor and trainer to new admission counselors, coordinate travel schedules and assignments, and assist with developing and implementing recruitment plans.
Review and evaluate prospective students' transcripts and applications for admission, counsel applicants regarding their eligibility status.
Develop and nurture relationships with influential contacts such as university department personnel, high school counselors, advisors, and community college liaisons.
Travel to conferences, high schools, colleges, and other learning institutions to publicize and explain admission requirements and procedures.
Answer phone calls and respond to e-mails from prospective students and their family members.
Assist in developing and implementing marketing and recruiting campaigns to achieve target enrollment goals.
Evaluate effectiveness and provide assessment of recruitment activities; provide written updates of territory and enrollment goals.
Assist other areas/departments on campus with recruitment efforts.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree with 2 years of experience counseling students in academic and scholastic matters or equivalent
